channel.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
channel.description:
Valve's Doug Lombardi has affirmed in an interview with AusGamer that the company are not done with Mr. Freeman and that fans will see him again. "You will ever see it, yes," Lombardi began. "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures. I have nothing other than that to﻿ tell you today, but stay tuned."
Was a lengthy interview between AusGamers and Valve; you can check out the whole thing here: [url]https://www.ausgamers.com/features/read/3037280[/url]
So, patiently waiting﻿ for this E3 (perhaps Valve reveal something related with Half-Life). If exist a saga that deserves a future is Half-Life.

item.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
I think that they might have realised that the Borealis wouldn’t have allowed for as much gameplay as the first 2 episodes, so I think they’ll release HL3 with it starting with the Borealis, something to do with the portal, and then after the ‘event’ the story will focus on what the G-Man said to Alyx and what she’ll do as a result.

Read full topic
item.source: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"

item.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
item.dc:creator: kaikarden
item.description:
I would just like to point out to everyone here that Valve publicly announced that they were having a bit of writers block on where to take freeman next. Thus is the reason Episode 3 has taken so long thus far.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
One of my mates at uni(/college) does a marketing course, and for one project about slow-burn advertising (I think that’s what he called it) he did an analysis of Valve’s strategy of teasing/dropping hints for ages to encourage fans to discuss it and get really buzzed (like we’re doing now!), and this teasing about Gordon seems to fit perfectly with their strategy.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
item.dc:creator: xsantosis
item.description:
jerry:

when HL3 comes, i hope it is as revolutionary and epic as HL1 and HL2 was.

I hope that if.

Jack Freeman:

have you ever heard of that gamer magazine i dont remember the name

The name of that magazine is gameinformer, here is the article: https://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2010/12/31/what-s-ahead-game-informer-s-2011-predictions.aspx

Dotard:

Well what if one of their surprise are both EP3 and HL3 released at once ?

If such a thing were to happen I would like it was a kind of The orange box 2 or The blue box, and to include HL2: EP3, HL3 and finally Portal 2.

P.S: excuse me for my bad English.

Read full topic

PS: excuse the delay in answering your question

item.title: Valve: "We are not done with Gordon Freeman's adventures"
item.dc:creator: xsantosis
item.description:
HalfeR:

Absolutely not. They’re working with other source games…Maybe EP3 project was frozen.

Well, maybe EP3 but not Half-Life 3 project, I believe that much time has passed for release a episodic version of Half-Life 2. I think that Valve only will be released Half-Life 3 instead of an episode of only 4 hours long.
